alert.note: Alert for Southeast Utah (Utah) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GrandJunction (Western Colorado and Eastern Utah)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 23 at 2:39PM MDT by NWS GrandJunction
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of south central San Juan County through 315 PM MDT... At 238 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Mexican Water, or 17 miles southeast of Mexican Hat, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of south central San Juan County. This includes U.S. Highway 191 in Utah between mile markers 1 and 8. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
